In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is how you can solve this problem in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(input, ' ')
    lines = String[]
    line = String[]

    for word in words
        if length(word)*2 <= text_width
            push!(line, word)
        else
            push!(lines, join(line, " "))
            line = [word]
        end
    end

    # add the remaining line to lines
    if !isempty(line)
        push!(lines, join(line, " "))
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Here's an example of how you can call this function:

```julia
input = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipiscing elit sed doe"
println(wrap_string(input))
```
Output would be:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet
consectetur adipiscing elit sed doe
```
